content: on what stitch is underneath from your row 2 then continue following the pattern from row 2 chain 3 and turn your work row 7 this is an odd numbered row so we will only be doing vs and not double_crochet clusters repeat the instructions for row 3 not skipping any spaces row 8 we will begin decreasing again remember on even numbered row double_crochet clusters should only go above the previous clusters from 2 row previous to decrease skip the first ch1 space and double_crochet a cluster or a v in the next ch1 space depending on what stitch is underneath from your row 2 then continue following the pattern from row 2 chain 3 and turn your work row 9 this is an odd numbered row so we will only be doing vs and not double_crochet clusters repeat the instructions for row 3 not skipping any spaces row 10 we will begin decreasing again remember on even numbered row double_crochet clusters should only go above the previous clusters from 2 row previous to decrease skip the first ch1 space and double_crochet a cluster or a v in the next ch1 space depending on what stitch is underneath from your row 2 then continue following pattern from row 2 chain 3 and turn your work continue decreasing on even row until you have one double_crochet cluster left and one v left based on the size you chose you should have this many row xs 10 / s 12 / m 14 / l 16 / xl 18 / 1x 20/22 / 2x 24/26 / 3x 28/30 on the odd numbered row after this we will decrease row 11 this is an odd numbered row so we will only be doing vs and not double_crochet clusters repeat the instructions for row 3 in the first double_crochet cluster or v in the next space the last space skip it and double_crochet in the top stitch of the ch3 post ch3 and turn your work strap counting from where you left off the triangle repeat odd and even row with only 1 space in width make 1 double_crochet cluster in the space in even row and one v in the space on odd row double_crochet at the end of the row and ch3 continue until the strap is long enough to reach the top of your shoulder as you can see i did 8 more row for my strap repeat the instructions from the beginning until now to make a second triangle and strap front stomach panel line up your front triangles together like this with the pointy ends of the decreasing slopes facing each other the straps pointing down and the flat sides of the bottom lined up to make one long line insert your hook into the very right corner of the right hand triangle row 1 starting at the very right corner of the right triangle single_crochet along the edge when you get to the end of the right
